title: Online Audiometer
description: Professional hearing test with interactive audiogram and interpretation
instructionsText: Click the ▶ button on a cell to play a tone. After hearing it, mark it as ✓ (heard) or ✗ (not heard). Work from quietest to loudest volumes to find your hearing threshold.
testResultsDesc: Complete the hearing test above to see your results
chartDescription: Your hearing threshold at different frequencies. The lower the line, the better your hearing at that frequency.
chartHowToRead: How to read it: Each point shows the quietest volume (in dB) where you could hear the tone. Lower dB values = better hearing.
downloadResultsDesc: Your comprehensive audiogram report has been saved
resultsClearedDesc: All test markers have been removed
testIncompleteDesc: Please complete testing all {{total}} frequencies before downloading. You have tested {{completed}} of {{total}}.
calibrationCompleteDesc: Your audiometer is now calibrated for accurate testing
startTestingInstructions: Start testing by clicking the ▶ Play button on cells. When you hear a sound, click the ✓ Heard button to mark it. Your hearing threshold will appear here automatically.
testingBoardDesc: Use Play (▶), Heard (✓), and Not Heard (✗) buttons
startTestingPrompt: Start testing by clicking the ▶ button on cells above. Mark cells as ✓ (heard) or ✗ (not heard) after playing each sound.

interp.title: Audiogram Interpretation
interp.completeTest: Complete your hearing test to see personalized interpretation and guidance.
interp.normalMessage: Your hearing appears to be in the normal range. Continue monitoring and protect your hearing from loud noise exposure.
interp.cautionMessage: Mild hearing changes detected. Consider consulting an audiologist for a comprehensive evaluation.
interp.warningMessage: Significant hearing loss detected. We strongly recommend scheduling an appointment with an audiologist or ENT specialist for professional evaluation and treatment options.
interp.highFreqLoss: High-frequency hearing loss detected (common with age and noise exposure)
interp.lowFreqLoss: Low-frequency hearing loss detected (less common, may indicate specific conditions)
interp.flatProfile: Relatively flat hearing profile across tested frequencies
interp.variableProfile: Significant variation across frequencies - consider full audiological evaluation
interp.disclaimer: This online tool is for screening purposes only and cannot replace professional audiological testing. Results may be affected by background noise, headphone quality, and calibration. For medical diagnosis or hearing aid fitting, please consult a licensed audiologist.
